ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic serous otitis media / Eustachian tube dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of ETD and PE tubes; unilateral mild conductive hearing loss; Type B tympanogram with normal ear canal volume indicating fluid.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and type of loss given reported deterioration.
To evaluate speech reception and recognition abilities.
To assess middle ear function and differentiate between fluid, perforation, or ossicular issues.
Standard battery test, though not measured in this instance.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Right ear findings were within normal limits. Left ear evaluation revealed a mild conductive hearing loss with a notch at 3000 Hz. Tympanometry showed a flat (Type B) trace with normal volume in the left ear, consistent with middle ear effusion/ETD. Speech recognition was excellent bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal (0-10 dB HL). Left ear mild conductive loss (flat ~35-40 dB HL) with a notch to 50 dB HL at 3000 Hz; air-bone gaps approx 30-40 dB.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT right 8 dB HL, left 35 dB HL. WRS 100% bilaterally at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear Type A (normal). Left ear Type B (flat) with normal ear canal volume (1.1 mL).

counseling_actions: Discussed hearing protection with emphasis on custom earplugs for use when riding dirt bike
Discussed results indicating conductive loss and need for medical follow-up

escalation.rationale_short: For medical management of left ear conductive hearing loss and suspected chronic serous otitis media.

follow_up_plan.timeline: After medical management and as needed
follow_up_plan.objective: To re-evaluate hearing thresholds following medical intervention.

expected_outcome: Patient followed up with an otologist as scheduled.
Audiological recommendations were to return for a hearing test after medical management and as needed.
